intro: Gymnanthes serrata var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth gymnanthes, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
